room_types.description: A cozy room designed for one person, featuring a comfortable single bed, suitable for solo travelers seeking comfort and privacy.
A spacious room accommodating two guests, equipped with either one double bed or two twin beds, ideal for couples or friends sharing a room.
Designed to comfortably accommodate three guests, this room offers a combination of beds, such as a double bed and a single bed, or three single beds.
A room featuring a queen-sized bed, suitable for up to two guests, offering a balance of space and comfort.
A luxurious room equipped with a king-sized bed, providing ample space and comfort for up to two guests.
Featuring two separate twin beds, this room is perfect for guests who prefer individual sleeping arrangements.
Equipped with two double beds, this room accommodates up to four guests, making it ideal for families.
A multifunctional space featuring a studio bed (a couch that converts into a bed) and may include additional amenities like a kitchenette.
An elegant suite offering separate living and sleeping areas, providing ample space and luxury for guests seeking an upgraded experience.
A smaller suite with a combined living and sleeping area, offering a taste of luxury and extra space.
A spacious suite featuring multiple rooms, including separate living and sleeping areas, designed for guests seeking premium comfort.
Designed for business travelers, this suite offers a dedicated workspace, meeting area, and luxurious sleeping quarters.
The most luxurious accommodation in the hotel, featuring expansive space, premium amenities, and exclusive services.
A luxurious top-floor suite featuring premium amenities, expansive views, and exclusive services for an unparalleled stay.
A standalone accommodation offering multiple rooms, private amenities like a pool or garden, ideal for families or groups seeking privacy.
Two rooms connected by a private door, allowing easy access between rooms, perfect for families or groups.
Designed for guests with disabilities, this room offers accessible features like wider doorways, grab bars, and modified bathroom facilities.
A room located near the pool or beach area, often featuring a private terrace, offering easy access to recreational facilities.
A standalone, single-story accommodation, often found in resorts, providing a private and intimate setting.
A modern, open-plan room with high ceilings, often featuring industrial design elements and ample natural light.
